授業目的:
• To equip students with English speaking and listening skills
• To provide students with guidance and practice in basic conversation
• To develop students’ academic listening, speaking and presentation skills
• To help students improve their English comprehensibility through pronunciation practice
• To improve TOEIC scores
到達目標:
Spring Semester Skills to be Achieved
1. Basic conversation skills
a. Articulation of complete ideas
b. Asking to repeat, clarification, confirmation
c. Asking for opinions
d. Asking questions to build the conversation
e. Agreeing and disagreeing
f. Pronunciation practice

2. Basic public speaking skills
a. Basic presentation structure
b. Delivery (fluency, body language, intonation, pronunciation)
c. Commonly used structures for presentations

3. Listening skills
a. Differences between the Japanese and English sound systems
b. English syllable structure
c. Recognizing topics
d. Introduction to TOEIC listening skills

The syllabus will be updated at the beginning of the class and during the semester as appropriate.

By the end of the program, students should be able to:
• Effectively communicate in spoken English through pair work, discussion, debate and presentation, and express their ideas across a variety areas including science-related topics
• Obtain adequate levels of listening comprehension through related materials
• Demonstrate a comprehensible level of English pronunciation
